International Tourism Marketing

This module will provide students with a coherent outline of the fundamental principles, concepts, policies and analytical frameworks of tourism marketing from an international perspective. This is a 30-credit supermodule delivered over two terms. This first half of the module focuses on destination marketing in the contemporary international tourism context, the second half focuses on marketing communications for tourism.

Learning Objectives:

+   Appraise the marketing implications of the tourism system.

+  Critically analyse the issues, trends and driving forces in contemporary international tourism marketing.

+  Critically appraise the conceptual and theoretical destination branding literature.

+  Develop and present a clear rationale, analysis and evaluation to support an integrated marketing communications plan for a specific tourist destination or visitor attraction.
